definitions.definition: simple past and past participle of have
examples: This morning I had an egg for breakfast.
A good time was had by all.

definitions.definition: Used to form the past perfect tense, expressing an action that took place prior to a reference point that is itself in the past.
examples: I felt sure that I had seen him before.
When I' d (already) done some exercise, I had a cappuccino.
definitions.label_groups: auxiliary , followed by a past participle

main_definition: simple past and past participle of have
secondary_definitions: ( auxiliary , followed by a past participle ) Used to form the past perfect tense, expressing an action that took place prior to a reference point that is itself in the past.
( auxiliary , now rare ) As past subjunctive : would have.
